alert.note: Alert for Bullock; Lee; Macon; Montgomery; Pike; Russell (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 3:14PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Pike, Lee, Bullock, Macon, southeastern Montgomery and western Russell Counties through 400 PM CST... At 313 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Beulah to near Franklin Field to Kent. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Auburn, Phenix City, Opelika, Tuskegee, Union Springs, Notasulga, Hurtsboro, Midway, Smiths, Meadville, Smiths Station, Franklin, Beulah, Dublin, Lake Tuskegee, Beans Crossroads, Guerryton, Shopton, Tuskegee National Forest and Beauregard. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM CST for south central Alabama. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 600 PM CST for southeastern and east central Alabama.

area.areaDesc: Bullock; Lee; Macon; Montgomery; Pike; Russell
